ygData.subject: Re: Discrete Neural Networks
ygData.msgSnippet: I was thinking about much more digitization, down to 8, 4 or even 1 bit. With one bit, everything is reduced to variants of the logical operators.  So we

I was thinking about much more digitization, down to 8, 4 or even 1 bit.

W=
ith one bit, everything is reduced to variants of the logical operators.  S=
o we wouldn't even have to worry about weights only the "activation functio=
ns" ie: operators.  We are likely to produce more structure, but that is wh=
at NEAT is good at.

This makes the search space MUCH smaller, though I sus=
pect much of the meaning of each bit has to be discovered first.  This got =
me thinking about using HyperNEAT's ability to establish relationships betw=
een inputs/outputs.  So what if we used a one bit substrate?  Something whe=
re any multibit inputs are arranged near each other, but where each bit can=
 be accessed separately?  Then we have only operators and  connections, but=
 no weights.  

People in this group have more experience with NN's so I am=
 just looking for a feasibility assessment before I start programing it and=
 possibly wasting my time.

Should I try this first with NEAT or HyperNEAT?=
